intro: Varronia galapagensis, commonly known as the Galápagos varronia, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small seeds. Varronia galapagensis is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the Galápagos, including its volcanic soil and climate.
